title: Disease Prevention and Control in Aquaculture

questions.question: What is the primary goal of biosecurity in aquaculture?
choices: To reduce the risk of disease transmission
questions.answer: To reduce the risk of disease transmission

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common type of pathogen in aquaculture?
What is the causative agent of Infectious Salmon Anemia (ISA)?
Which of the following is a symptom of Viral Nervous Necrosis (VNN)?
What is the primary host for sea lice in aquaculture?
Which disease is caused by the protozoan parasite Ichthyophthirius multifiliis?
What is the main purpose of quarantine procedures in aquaculture?
choices: To prevent the introduction of diseases
questions.answer: To prevent the introduction of diseases

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a component of a biosecurity plan?
What is the primary role of government in aquaculture disease control?
Which of the following is an example of a coordinated disease control strategy?
choices: Individual farmers keeping disease outbreaks secret
Information sharing between farms and regions
questions.answer: Information sharing between farms and regions

questions.question: What is the estimated economic loss from the ISA outbreak in Chile between 2007-2009?
Which of the following is NOT a typical symptom of bacterial diseases in fish?
What type of pathogen causes Vibriosis in aquaculture?
Which of the following is a key component of early detection systems in aquaculture?
What is the primary purpose of foot baths in aquaculture facilities?
Which of the following is NOT a typical method for treating water in aquaculture systems?
What is the main purpose of vaccination programs in aquaculture?
Which of the following is an example of a stress reduction strategy in aquaculture?
What is the primary role of rapid diagnostic techniques like PCR in disease control?
Which of the following is NOT typically part of a government's role in aquaculture disease control?
What is the main purpose of proper dead fish disposal in aquaculture?
Which of the following is an example of a collaborative approach to disease management?
What is the primary purpose of stock health monitoring in aquaculture?
Which of the following is NOT typically a part of personal protective equipment (PPE) in aquaculture?
What is the main purpose of implementing movement restrictions during a disease outbreak?
Which of the following is an example of a rapid diagnostic technique used in aquaculture?
What is the primary purpose of isolation tanks in aquaculture facilities?
choices: To quarantine new or sick fish
questions.answer: To quarantine new or sick fish

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical role of the aquaculture industry in disease control?
choices: Participating in voluntary disease control programs

questions.question: What is the main purpose of regular record-keeping in aquaculture health management?
choices: To track disease patterns and treatments
questions.answer: To track disease patterns and treatments

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a preventive measure against disease in aquaculture?
